articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vietnamese Military Delegation Head
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vietnamese Military Delegation Head

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of the delegation of the Vietnamese Defense Ministry on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					Lieut. General Nguyen Chi Vinh, deputy minister of Defence who is leading the delegation, handed it over to an official concerned on Friday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Military Delegation Tours Various Places
articles.content:
Vietnamese Military Delegation Tours Various Places

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Vietnamese Ministry of Defence headed by Lieutenant General Nguyen Chi Vinh, deputy minister of Defence, visited the Party Founding Memorial Tower.
					
					Being briefed on the undying feats performed by President         Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the cause of building the Juche-oriented revolutionary party and the might of the Workers' Party of Korea, the visitors looked round the body, circular belt and platform of the Tower of peculiar shape.
					
					They also visited the units of the Korean People's Army and saw the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".

articles.title: DPRK, U.S. Militaries to Hold Talks for Excavation of Remains of GIs
articles.content:
DPRK, U.S. Militaries to Hold Talks for Excavation of Remains of GIs

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Friday as regards the resumption of the excavation of remains of GIs between the DPRK and the U.S.:
					
					The U.S. side, some time ago, sent an official letter to the DPRK side through an appropriate channel, requesting it to hold talks for the excavation of remains of GIs.
					
					The DPRK affirmatively accepted the U.S. proposal for holding talks from humanitarianism.
					
					Work for talks between the militaries of the DPRK and the U.S. is now under way.

articles.title: U.S. Decides to Offer Emergency Relief Goods to DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Decides to Offer Emergency Relief Goods to DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The government of the United States of America decided to provide the flood-stricken DPRK with emergency relief goods.

articles.title: Russian Govt. Offers Food Aid to DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Govt. Offers Food Aid to DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The government of the Russian Federation decided to provide the DPRK with grant-in-aid of 50 000 tons of food. The first ship loaded with food arrived in Hungnam Port on Friday. Other aid ships are expected to come to the DPRK in the future.
					
					Food valuing at 5 million U.S. dollars donated by the Russian government through the WFP is also being provided to the DPRK.
					
					The free food aid to the DPRK by the Russian government is a manifestation of the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the governments and peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Chinese Conduct Medical Service in DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Conduct Medical Service in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A Chinese delegation of the medical service visited the DPRK from August 10 to 19.
					
					During the visit the delegation grouping officials of the Jilin Provincial Public Health Agency and competent medical workers at the Jilin University hospital No. 2 and the people's hospital in Jilin Province conducted sincere medical service for inhabitants at the People's Hospital in Jongphyong County, South Hamgyong Province.
					
					Upon the authorization of the Chinese Ministry of Public Health, the delegation donated medicines to the DPRK Ministry of Public Health and exchanged medical technology and experience with the medical workers at the Jongphyong County People's Hospital.
					
					The members of the delegation said that they were pleased to conduct the medical service at a time when the Sino-DPRK friendship is growing stronger day by day.

articles.title: Floral Tribute to Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Floral Tribute to Kim Po Hyon

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of ardent patriot Kim Po Hyon in Mangyongdae on August 19, the 140th anniversary of his birth.
					
					Seen before it was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Participated in wreath-laying ceremony were leading officials of the party and state, officials of the party, armed forces and power  bodies, social organizations, ministries, national institutions, KPA servicepersons and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					Wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, social organizations, ministries, national institutions and party and power institutions and farms in Pyongyang were placed before the grave.
					
					The participants observed a moment silence in memory of Kim Po Hyon, looking back on his noble life dedicated to the future of the country and nation.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to IIJI Researcher
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to IIJI Researcher

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class was awarded to Noriaki Ouchi, a researcher of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI), according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
					
					He has contributed to the study and dissemination of the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and enriched and developed by leader Kim Jong Il and to the accomplishment of the cause of global independence.
					
					The conferment ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					
					Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the SPA Presidium, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Tele-education Available in DPRK
articles.content:
Tele-education Available in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Tele-education has proved successful throughout the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					Educational institutions and IT units have directed efforts to putting the nation's online education service on a high level.
					
					Kim Chaek University of Technology succeeded in testing tele-education service for technicians at the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and Chollima Steel Complex and is now expanding the success all over the country.
					
					Kim Hyong Jik University of Education is rendering in-service training to all its teachers through network.
					
					The Ministry of Public Health uses the tele-medicine system established between central and provincial hospitals not only for medical treatment but for training of doctors.
					
					The Grand People's Study House provides online education through its website.
					
					Many people visit the website to get necessary scientific and technological knowledge without going to the study house.
					
					Libraries across the country have computerized their service activities.

articles.title: Sungyang School in Korea
articles.content:
Sungyang School in Korea

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Sungyang School is located in Sonjuk-dong, Kaesong City, the DPRK. The school was built at the site of the house of Jong Mong Ju (1337-1392), a high-ranking government official in the late period of Koryo, and rebuilt in 1573. 
					
					The school at the foot of Mt. Janam served as an educational institution as well as a Confucian idea dissemination centre. 
					
					Its original name was Munchung Hall but it was renamed Sungyang School in 1575. 
					
					The school includes dormitories, an auditorium and a shrine. 
					
					The school was destroyed by the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War but restored to the original state thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of preserving cultural relics.

articles.title: Literary Writing Activities Brisk among School Youth and Children in DPRK
articles.content:
Literary Writing Activities Brisk among School Youth and Children in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Literary writing activities are brisk among school youth and children in the DPRK.
					
					During the period of mass literature prize contest this year, the number of entries increased more than 1 000 over the same period last year.
					
					Among them are works reflecting the ardent yearnings of the Korean people and school youth and children for President Kim Il Sung and praising the feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Some other works vividly portray the ideological and moral world of young Koreans demonstrating their talents and gallantry in every work site of a great surge, the stirring reality of the country and the happy life of the Korean people.
					
					Words of songs, compositions, etc. reflecting the pledge of the school children to prepare themselves to be the pillars of Songun Korea were also among the entries.

articles.title: Performance of Drama "We Will Recollect Today" Given in Local City
articles.content:
Performance of Drama "We Will Recollect Today" Given in Local City

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A performance of drama "We Will Recollect Today", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, was given at the Hamhung Grand Theater of South Hamgyong Province Friday.
					
					Appreciating it were officials of party and power bodies and working people's organizations and working people in the province.
					
					The drama left deep impression on the audience as it vividly depicted the ideological and moral world of genuine patriots who live for tomorrow, not for today and their persevering fighting spirit.
					
					After watching the drama, the officials said they were deeply moved by it, adding the drama serves as a textbook teaching them the place to stand and the attitude and stance to take.
					
					They vowed to remain loyal to the party's Songun leadership and put spurs to the drive for the improvement of the people's living so as to recollect today.
					
					The performance continues.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Meet
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Meet

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A celebration meeting of agricultural workers took place in Tongbong-ri, Hamju County, South Hamgyong Province Friday to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Present there were Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, Ju Song Il, secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and agricultural workers.
					
					At the meeting a reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership through his field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, Juche 49 (1960). This was a noteworthy event that provided an epochal turn in developing the revolutionary armed forces of Korea and carrying out the revolutionary cause of Juche, they stressed.
					
					General Kim Jong Il is the peerlessly illustrious commander of Songun as he tided over the difficulties with his matchless courage and pluck and put our country on the position of a world military power, they added.
					
					They referred to the need to remain faithful to the Songun leadership of the Party, cherishing the faith that victory in building a prosperous and powerful country and the eternal prosperity of Kim Il Sung's Korea are guaranteed by the way they hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Giving Full Play to Self-reliance in DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Giving Full Play to Self-reliance in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Self-reliance provides a short-cut to an economic power and a key to a gate of a thriving nation.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The Korean people's indomitable fighting spirit of solving everything by their own efforts has become a mode of their existence and a powerful force pushing forward the revolution and construction despite the passage of time and replacement of generations, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The Korean revolutionary history could emerge so great and the Korean people such revolutionary people as the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance provided in the flames of the anti-Japanese war has been carried forward from generation to generation and century after century.
					
					The Korean people have regarded the self-reliance as an immutable principle in the economy construction for decades and, therefore, made no even single deviation from the principle of socialism. They held the banner of ideology higher in face of manifold trials and difficulties and turned adversity into prosperity and misfortune into blessing by mobilizing the strength of the popular masses.
					
					The Korean people are not weak people afraid of difficulties. They are staunch revolutionaries and ardent patriots who created new Chollima speed of Korea in the era of Songun, proving in practice the faith that Korea does whatever it is determined to do.
					
					All the people should give full play to the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and perform new miracles and merits in the drive to build an economic power and improve the standard of people's living, concludes the article.

articles.title: Japan's Claim to Tok Islets Termed Daydream
articles.content:
Japan's Claim to Tok Islets Termed Daydream

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government in its "defense white paper for 2011", the second one since the emergence of the Democratic Party, said that "the issue of Takeshima, territory belonging to Japan, still remains outstanding."
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					This indicates that Japan's attempt to secure "dominium over Tok Islets" remains same both under the rule of the Liberal Democratic Party and the Democratic Party, the commentary notes.
					
					Citing facts to prove the reckless moves of the Japanese militarists persistently claiming to the islets, the commentary says:
					
					Only the Japanese reactionaries steeped in the ambition for reinvasion to the marrow of their bones can make such a nonsensical talk that other's inviolable territory belongs to Japan.
					
					What Japan seeks through the claim to Tok Islets is to build up public opinion over the issue, internationalize it and spark off disputes over the islets and thus create a condition and pretext for the reinvasion of Korea.
					
					Japan's real intention is to stage a comeback to Korea with the seizure of the islets as an occasion. Herein lie the aggressive nature of Japan's moves to grab the islets and their danger and gravity.
					
					Its ambition to take Tok Islets is a daydream. The Japanese reactionaries should not give its eye-teeth for the islets.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea UFG Joint Military Exercises Blasted
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea UFG Joint Military Exercises Blasted

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. together with south Korea kicked off the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises targeted against the DPRK, its dialogue partner. This has left the DPRK skeptical about the U.S. call for the sincerity of dialogue.
					
					Minju Joson Friday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					The U.S. whets the sword for aggression to do harm to its dialogue partner despite its lip-service for dialogue and peace. It is its trite artifice, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					Peace has not yet settled on the Korean Peninsula due to the U.S. double-dealing attitude.
					
					The U.S. described war exercises it waged every year against the DPRK as "annual ones" and the "drills of defensive nature". With no rhetoric, however, can it cover up its aim to stifle the DPRK by force of arms based on the theory of strength. It is clearly evidenced by the focus of the on-going exercises being put on the "elimination of the WMDs from the north".
					
					This shows that the U.S. contemplates creating the military atmosphere favorable for carrying out its policy of stifling the DPRK by mounting a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK in "contingency" and neutralizing its nuclear deterrent for self-defence at the same time.
					
					Peace on the Korean Peninsula is directly linked with peace of the world. It is quite unjust for the U.S., a country holding unavoidable responsibility, to take ambiguous and double-dealing attitude.
					
					The U.S. would be well advised to clarify its stand on whether it wants dialogue or war.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea Urged to Stop UFG
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea Urged to Stop UFG

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The provocative Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises kicked off by the south Korean authorities to threaten and invade the DPRK are blatant challenge to peace.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					All war maneuvers staged by south Korea in collusion with the U.S. are criminal acts of harassing peace on the Korean Peninsula, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					War exercises are the main factor of escalating tension. There is no reason for the south Korean authorities to conduct war exercises against the DPRK in league with foreign forces, if they truly want dialogue and peace.
					
					It is a lesson taught by history that the inter-Korean relations can never be improved nor can peace on the peninsula be expected, unless military tension of confrontation is defused.
					
					The reality shows that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' lip-service for dialogue and peace is no more than a wordplay to deceive and befool the public and a wicked ploy to put into practice their ambition to invade the north.
					
					If the U.S. and the south Korean authorities truly want dialogue and peace, they should stop at once the war exercises against the DPRK.

articles.title: Action against Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action against Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets Declared in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party (DLP) of south Korea in a commentary on August 15 declared an action to stand against Japan's moves to grab Tok Islets.
					
					66 years have passed since the Japanese imperialists were defeated, the commentary said. It accused Japan of trying to revive the nightmare of the past colonial rule, while foolishly dreaming about grabbing Tok Islets and reviving militarism, oblivious of a lesson drawn from its defeat.
					
					Japan has now become all the more covetous for the islets, a proof of the present south Korean "government's" diplomatic failure, it noted.
					
					It strongly demanded the authorities concentrate all efforts on exposing and denouncing Japan's provocation.
					
					There will be no future of Tok Islets if we forget Japan's past history in which it tried to deprive the Korean nation of even its soul, it said, stressing that the DLP would come out for action to defend the islets in the future.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Jeju Islanders, Biggest Since 1948
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Jeju Islanders, Biggest Since 1948

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities on August 14 hurled police of five companies equipped with water cannons and other repressive gears to Jeju Island to put down the protesters opposing the construction of a naval base there.
					
					On August 15 the authorities issued an emergency alert order to all the repressive forces on Jeju Island.
					
					Members of the All-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking the Jeju Military Base, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other organizations of south Korea, Kangjong villagers, peace activists and opposition party members protested against the puppet security authorities' fascist suppression on Jeju Island on August 15.
					
					They tied themselves with wires and set up barricades in street corners likely to be manned with police.
					
					It is the first time since the April 3 Popular Uprising on Jeju Island in 1948 that the repressive forces were hurled from the inland to put down the people's action, they said. The authorities' repressive actions have gone beyond the danger line, they added.
					
					The authorities' fascist crackdown will meet a strong protest of the people, they warned.
					
					The south Korean Measure Council for Checking the Construction of Jeju Naval Base in a statement on August 15 said the authorities' intensified suppression may lead to the recurrence of the massacre during the April 3 Popular Uprising.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Marine Corps Stage Maneuvers for Preemptive Attack on DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Marine Corps Stage Maneuvers for Preemptive Attack on DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers are staging madcap drill for preemptive attack on the DPRK in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province from August 15 under the pretext of "anti-terrorism."
					
					Involved in the drill which is to last till August 25 are the marine crops affiliated with the U.S. Pacific Fleet and the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					They are set to wage exercises for street warfare including advance and mobile operations and sharp-shooting and guerilla exercises.
					
					The joint saber-rattling brings into bolder relief its nature of attack on the north as it is timed to coincide with Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.

articles.title: Seoul Court Criticized for Wrong Decision
articles.content:
Seoul Court Criticized for Wrong Decision

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea made a comment Tuesday as regards the Seoul High Court's decision on military judicial officers who protested the regulation on "seditious books" made by the Ministry of Defense. 
					
					The comment said that the court decided to withdraw their punishment of dismissal but sustained the first trial judgment that they defamed the military and violated political neutrality. 
					
					By the "seditious books" the Ministry of Defense means popular books, including contemporary history textbooks, according to the comment.
					
					It is abnormal that import of such books is prohibited as they are considered "seditious" only in the military, and it is anachronistic to term the protest against the regulation illegal, said the comment.
					
					The comment urged the court to pass a decision of guiltlessness upon the officers.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea Urged to Stop Military Nexus
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea Urged to Stop Military Nexus

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Peace movement organizations of south Korea and Japan held a joint symposium in Seoul on August 15 calling for an end to the military alliance for aggression threatening the peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					To build a peace mechanism in the peninsula at an early date is an important issue for peace in Northeast Asia, speakers said. This is possible when the U.S.-south Korea military alliance is abolished, they added.
					
					The U.S. and Japan are making earnest preparations for a nuclear war in the peninsula and arms buildup and intensifying the military cooperation system with south Korea, they noted.
					
					To achieve peace in the peninsula it is necessary to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty and a priority task here is to get the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea, they said.
					
					They called upon all the forces aspiring after peace to pool their efforts to cope with the intensified military tie-up of the trigger-happy forces.

articles.title: Stop to Provocative UFG Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Provocative UFG Urged in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification demanded a stop to the war maneuvers against the DPRK. They held the 143rd action for independence, reunification and peace outside the command and control station of the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" in Songnam, Kyonggi Province on August 16.
					
					The organizations accused the warlike forces of starting the Ulji Freedom Guardian (UFG) joint military exercises across south Korea with huge armed forces involved.
					
					The warlike forces are describing the exercises as "defensive ones" but they are apparently aimed at aggression as they are based on the "OPLAN 5027," a scenario for attacking the north, and the "Chungmu Plan" aiming at securing a rule over the occupied areas, they said.
					
					UFG, which is consistent with aggression against the north in view of its purpose and nature, scale and contents, is a wanton violation of the agreements reached between the north and the south of Korea including the June 15 joint declaration, they noted.
					
					They urged the trigger-happy forces to drop the double-dealing attitude such as talking about peace on one hand and openly staging the exercises for aggression on the other.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Lectures were held by the Guinean Group for the Study of February 16 Art and the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa on August 9 to mark the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Riyad Chaloub, chief of the Guinean Group, at a lecture titled "Exploit of Korea's liberation by President Kim Il Sung shines long" gave a detailed explanation of the immortal exploits by the President.
					
					Korea's liberation marked a dramatic turning point in hewing out the destiny of the Korean people and was a historical event that gave birth to socialist Korea, he said, and continued:
					
					The liberation of Korea led to the foundation of the DPRK, a genuine country for the people for the first time in the nation's history spanning 5 000 years.
					
					Formerly backward colonial and semi-feudal Korea turned into a powerful socialist state.
					
					The exploits by Kim Il Sung for Korea's liberation will remain long along with the prospering socialist Korea.
					
					Eddie Kekana, chairman of the South African Group, noted at a lecture titled "With superb guerrilla tactics" that the Japanese imperialists sustained a shameful defeat by the outstanding war method of Kim Il Sung.
					
					He continued:
					
					Kim Il Sung won successive victories in many battles fought during the anti-Japanese war with his unusual and mysterious war tactics.
					
					The President's feats by which he liberated the country with superb guerrilla tactics will shine long in the world history of national liberation movement in colonial countries.
					
					A reading session, round-table talks and film show took place by the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and at the Badja Machine Co. of Indonesia and the hospital of the Guinean Ministry of Defence in the period between August 3 and 12.

articles.title: British Organizations Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
British Organizations Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on August 12 to mark the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The statement said that the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) liberated Korea on August 15, 1945 under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, gifted strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					Korea's liberation put an end to the dark era of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. The Korean people were freed from the oppression and fetters by the Japanese imperialists and greeted the dawn of independence, it noted, and continued:
					
					Korea's liberation was the most valuable gains Kim Il Sung brought about by leading the heroic KPRA to victory with his Juche-oriented guerrilla war method.
					
					The anti-Japanese armed struggle proved the truth of the Songun idea.
					
					The anti-Japanese armed struggle conducted under the revolutionary banner of Juche greatly inspired the oppressed people in the world in their struggle for independence.
					
					This served as a model for the world people working hard for independence against imperialism and colonialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by French, Ukrainian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by French, Ukrainian Figures

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held by the French Group for the Study of the Juche and Songun Idea and a lecture titled "Songun leadership is an inheritance of tradition established in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle" by the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea on Sunday. They were to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group, made a speech. He said that the imperialists are becoming all the more pronounced in their moves for military aggression and intervention in many countries and regions of the world. This reality clearly proves that the Songun policy is, indeed, an almighty treasured sword that firmly safeguards the sovereignty and dignity of the country and reliably guarantees the regional peace and stability, he noted, adding:
					
					No wonder the world progressive people are extending support and solidarity to the Korean people, praising their resolute struggle against the imperialists in the van of the anti-imperialist front under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian Association, at the lecture emphasized that Kim Jong Il had developed in depth the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and fully embodied the Songun policy.
					
					Under Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership the international position and authority of the DPRK have been remarkably strengthened and the independent dignity of the Korean people further enhanced, he said. It is an irresistible trend of the times to develop the relations with the DPRK making a leaping progress toward a thriving nation, he added.
					
					Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events.

articles.title: DPRK's Songun Politics Praised by Nepali, Palestinian Press
articles.content:
DPRK's Songun Politics Praised by Nepali, Palestinian Press

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A Nepali paper and a Palestinian magazine carried special write-ups on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					A Nepali paper on August 1 carried an article titled "Songun and Kim Jong Il" with his portrait.
					
					Kim Jong Il has developed in depth the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, and formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism, the paper said, and went on:
					
					The Songun politics is the most effective political mode which guarantees the triumphant advance of the cause of socialism and independence despite the ever-more undisguised high-handed and arbitrary practices of the imperialists.
					
					Kim Jong Il put forward the Korean People's Army as the main force of the revolution and put the national power on the highest level by relying on it. The DPRK, therefore, could firmly defend socialism in the worst adversity. It is now advancing towards the high eminence of a thriving nation by leaps and bounds.
					
					It is thanks to his Songun politics that a solid foundation was laid to achieve the independent reunification of the Korean nation. All the attempts of the U.S. and the south Korean warlike forces to ignite a new war in the Korean Peninsula have been foiled and the regional peace and security firmly guaranteed. 
					
					The international position and authority have been enhanced thanks to his Songun politics.
					
					The August issue of the Palestinian magazine Ilal Amam edited an article headlined "Kim Jong Il, Songun leadership and modern Korea" with his photo.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans Overseas
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans Overseas

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held an event on August 15, the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Present there were members of the Koreans' organizations and Koreans in Uzbekistan and the charge d' affaires ad interim and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Tashkent.
					
					The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full-length figure portrait of President Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il at the embassy and paid tribute to them.
					
					At the event speakers said the President led the rigorous anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to victory to achieve the historic cause of Korea's liberation on August 15, 1945.
					
					The President's revolutionary cause is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, they noted.
					
					He is giving continuity to the Songun revolutionary leadership to build a thriving socialist state true to the intention of the President, they stated.
					
					A photo exhibition and a film show were held on the same day.
					
					The U.S. Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the U.S. Western Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and other organizations of Koreans in the U.S. held an event in Los Angeles on August 13 on the same occasion.

articles.title: China Launches Satellite
articles.content:
China Launches Satellite

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- China on August 16 successfully launched Haiyang-2 by a Long March-4B carrier rocket from the launch center in the city of Taiyuan.

articles.title: China Calls for Ensuring Railway Security
articles.content:
China Calls for Ensuring Railway Security

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- China had a meeting in Beijing on Monday and Tuesday to discuss comprehensively inspecting the security of high-speed railways and those under construction and eliminating shortcomings.
					
					Addressing the meeting Zhang Dejiang, a vice-premier of the State Council, called on the inspection teams to take a responsible manner and strictly deal with what may cause accidents in high-speed railway service.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Calls for Promoting Harmonious Labor Relations
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Calls for Promoting Harmonious Labor Relations

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- Promoting harmonious labor relations serves as a foundation of social harmony, said a senior Chinese official.
					
					Addressing a national meeting on the forming of harmonious labor relations held in Beijing from Monday to Tuesday, Vice President Xi Jinping said it is also a requisite to strengthening the Communist Party's ruling basis and consolidating its ruling position.
					
					He urged party committees and government bodies at all levels to improve labor law and regulations, ensure their implementation and solve labor disputes so as to promote social harmony.

articles.title: Full Display of Yenan Spirit Urged in China
articles.content:
Full Display of Yenan Spirit Urged in China

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- A senior Chinese official recently called for fully displaying the great spirit of Yenan.
					
					During his inspection tour of Shaanxi Province, Jia Qinglin, chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, said the province should avail itself of important opportunities of the government's grand western development strategy in order to build a well-off and powerful province.
					
					He also emphasized the need to base all ideas and activities on the leadership's analysis and decision and make a good start of the effort for socio-economic development in the 12th five-year plan.

articles.title: International Exposition Expected in West China
articles.content:
International Exposition Expected in West China

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- The 12th West China International Exposition will be held from October 18 to 22. 
					
					52 countries and regions are likely to take part in the exposition.
					
					The exposition will include west China cooperation, international cooperation, new high technology, electronic information, equipment manufacture and agriculture and industry halls.

articles.title: China's Measure for Preschoolers
articles.content:
China's Measure for Preschoolers

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Chinese city of Tianjin made rules of building kindergartens in new residential districts for education of children under school age. 
					
					The General Office of the Tianjin Municipal People's Government recently issued a notice that any plan to construct a residential district without kindergarten can not be approved.

articles.title: Proper Management of Social Security Funds Urged in China
articles.content:
Proper Management of Social Security Funds Urged in China

					Beijing, August 18 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao, presiding over a State Council meeting Wednesday, underscored the need to properly manage social security funds.
					
					It was stressed at the meeting that for this purpose, it is necessary to upgrade the level of performing the fund budget, ensure a scientific management of the funds and make a unified plan.

articles.title: China, Thailand Stage Anti-Terrorism Exercise
articles.content:
China, Thailand Stage Anti-Terrorism Exercise

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Chinese and Thai navies began a three-day anti-terrorism exercise on Wednesday. 
					
					A supplier and two missile frigates of the Chinese navy arrived in a naval base in the eastern area of Thailand on Tuesday.
					
					A high-ranking officer of the Thai navy said the exercise was a mock cooperation drill battling terrorism in the sea.

articles.title: International Aerospace Exhibition Opens in Russia
articles.content:
International Aerospace Exhibition Opens in Russia

					Moscow, August 18 (KCNA) -- An international aerospace exhibition opened in Zhukovskiy in the suburbs of Moscow on Tuesday.
					
					5G fighters and other latest-type military and civilian aircraft and some ten kinds of new rocket engines are on display in the exhibition. 
					
					The exhibition continues by August 21.

articles.title: China-U.S. Distrust Remains Unchanged: Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
China-U.S. Distrust Remains Unchanged: Russian Newspaper

					Moscow, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspaper Nezabisimaya Gazetta July 28 carried an article titled "China-U.S. Military Exchange Has Long Way to Go to Reach Confidence Building".
					
					Some time ago, China warned that U.S. reconnaissance flights near the country were hurting confidence between the two countries and hampering the bilateral military ties and urged the U.S. to respect the country's sovereignty and security interests, the article said, adding: 
					
					But Mike Mullen, chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, stated such flights would continue, an apparent sign of turning down Beijing's demand.
					
					Two weeks ago, Mullen visited China and had talks with Chen Bingde, chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. At that time he said the contact with China's top military officials inspired him with hope. 
					
					Back home, however, he said the U.S. would never give up its commitments to its allies and partners.
					
					Analysts are of the view that his remark has a clear meaning. At the talks Chen Bingde told Mullen that not only the Obama Administration's promise to sell 6.4 billion dollars worth of weapons to Taiwan but the reconnaissance flights and approach of vessels near China were impeding confidence building. 
					
					The fact goes to prove that distrust between the two countries remains unchanged with no side willing to make a concession.
					
					Now the U.S. is afraid that the Chinese army has modernized itself rapidly. U.S. officials believe that China is getting ready to challenge the U.S. in the west Pacific that has been under control of the U.S. Seventh Fleet for more than half a century.
					
					They are citing as proof the launch of China's first aircraft carrier, test of stealth bomber and modern submarines and development of 1 000-mile-range missile capable of striking U.S. carriers.

articles.title: Global Foodstuff Prices Up
articles.content:
Global Foodstuff Prices Up

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Foodstuff prices went up 33 percent in the world in July compared with the same month of last year, said the World Bank in its announcement released Monday.
					
					In particular, maize price increased 84 percent, sugar 62 percent, wheat 55 percent and bean oil 47 percent.

articles.title: Central European Nations to Form Military Organization
articles.content:
Central European Nations to Form Military Organization

					Moscow, August 18 (KCNA) -- Russian newspaper Krasnaya Zbezda July 6-12 carried an article titled "Why Did Four Central European Nations Decide to Form Independent Military Organization?"
					
					In May defense ministers of Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia and Hungary agreed to organize a combat unit under the command of Poland.
					
					According to their plan released on May 12, a special combat unit will be formed under the command of Poland in around 2016 to become an independent unit not belonging to NATO. And the four nations will stage annual joint military exercises from 2013 in the framework of the NATO's existing rapid reaction force.
					
					From the general point of view, it is the conclusion of Western diplomats that the decision to form an independent military organization is a reaction of east European nations to the new development observed by the European Union and NATO. In other words, the development means that Germany is seeking a special role as the EU leader and trying to expand cooperation with Russia, while the U.S. capacity of taking part in overseas military operations is being decreased.
					
					According to sources, it is under discussion to invite Ukraine to join the combat unit. But Western analysts doubt that Kiev will accept the anti-Russia offering.

articles.title: More Gun-related Crimes in U.S.
articles.content:
More Gun-related Crimes in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Gun-related crimes are being reported in succession in the U.S., throwing people into constant uneasiness and fear.
					
					A man was killed and another injured Saturday in a shooting of an unidentified criminal in Garden Grove in California.
					
					At last two people were killed and six others wounded in five separate overnight shootings around Chicago, Illinois on August 12.

articles.title: Number of Suicide Increase in U.S. Army
articles.content:
Number of Suicide Increase in U.S. Army

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The number of soldiers committing suicide out of war-phobia and despair is on steady increase in the U.S. Army units, troubling the military.
					
					The number stood at 32 in army units in July, the Defense Department said quoting recent survey data.
					
					This has brought the total number of suicidal cases in the first seven months of this year to 160.

articles.title: Ahmadinejad Warns Israel
articles.content:
Ahmadinejad Warns Israel

					Teheran, August 18 (KCNA) -- Iran will respond "decisively" if the United States or Israel attempt to attack the Islamic Republic, President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad told Russia Today.
					
					"They wish to do it, they want to do it, but they know about our power. They know we are going to give them a decisive response. We have a saying in our language if someone throws a smaller stone, you should respond with a bigger stone. We will defend ourselves within our capabilities," Ahmadinejad said in an exclusive interview with the Russian network published Sunday.

articles.title: CSTO Informal Summit Held in Astana, Kazakhstan
articles.content:
CSTO Informal Summit Held in Astana, Kazakhstan

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The fifth informal summit of the heads of the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO) member-states took place in the Kazakhstan's capital city of Astana on Friday.
					
					The presidents of Russia, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Armenia, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan were present at the meeting.
					
					The leaders of CSTO member states planned to exchange views on key international problems, including the situation in the Middle East, North Africa, as well as in the organization's member states. They also discussed certain aspects of the organization's work and ways to make it more effective.

articles.title: Nigeria Says Committed to Sustaining Peace
articles.content:
Nigeria Says Committed to Sustaining Peace

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian government is committed to ensuring peace in the country, with particular attention to the northeastern part of the country, Minister of Defense Bello Mohammed has said.
					
					Bello gave the assurance on Thursday in Abuja during a news conference, adding that efforts were being made to make the armed forces civilian friendly in their approach to security issues.
					
					He said the armed forces were doing well in protecting lives and property in various theatres of internal security and peace keeping operations.
					
					"Let me stress that the Federal Government is committed to maintaining peace and order and will not allow any miscreant to thwart this effort under whatever guise," the minister said.

articles.title: Iran Rejects West's False Report
articles.content:
Iran Rejects West's False Report

					Tehran, August 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Iran in a press conference on August 16 bitterly rejected the West's false report against his country.
					
					The West's media recently reported that Iran is set to build a military base in Syria. This is a lie and is aimed at inventing a pretext to interfere in the internal affairs of the regional countries. It is also aimed to divert elsewhere the social complaints growing in the Western countries and the public attention focused on it, the spokesman said.
					
					Media of Western countries would be well advised to pay attention to the issues arising in their own countries, he noted.

articles.title: S. American Nations Launch Anti-crisis Fund
articles.content:
S. American Nations Launch Anti-crisis Fund

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- South American financial chiefs and central bankers decided Friday to launch an anti-crisis fund toward the region against global economic malaise.
					
					"We are working in the building of a regional fund to face the international financial crisis," Argentine Finance Minister Amado Boudou told a press conference.
					
					According to Secretary General Maria Emma Mejia of the Union of South American Nations, the fund will be drawn from the foreign reserves of regional central banks.
					
					Besides, the South American policymakers have also agreed to promote the use of local currencies in the region's internal trade.

articles.title: Israeli Strike Kills Gaza Gunman
articles.content:
Israeli Strike Kills Gaza Gunman

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Israeli air strikes in the Gaza Strip on Tuesday killed one gunman and wounded five other Palestinians, medical sources said.
					
					The brutalities have lashed Palestinians and the international community into a great fury.

articles.title: Different Countries Cooperate
articles.content:
Different Countries Cooperate

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- China and Romania on August 15 agreed to expand country-to-country investment in the infrastructure construction.
					
					On the same day Russia and Belarus agreed to strengthen bilateral cooperation in the economic, defense, science, etc.

articles.title: Syria Blasts Israeli Suppression of Inhabitants on Golan Heights
articles.content:
Syria Blasts Israeli Suppression of Inhabitants on Golan Heights

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Syrian ambassador at the UN in a recent letter to the secretary general of the UN General Assembly strongly blasted Israeli illegal act.
					
					The Israeli occupation authorities have begun the construction of a racist separation fence on the occupied Syrian-Golan, the letter recalled, branding it as the continuation of an aggressive Israeli policy against the citizens of the Golan.
					
					Such moves of Israel will bring greater sufferings to the inhabitants on the Golan Heights and aggravate the regional situation, the letter noted.

articles.title: Jordanian MPs Protest against Israeli Moves to Expand Settlements
articles.content:
Jordanian MPs Protest against Israeli Moves to Expand Settlements

					Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A total of 13 Jordanian parliament members in a memo they signed on Sunday scathingly denounced Israel for its ceaseless moves to expand Jewish settlements.
					
					They condemned the Israeli authorities for recently announcing in succession the plans to build new Jewish settlements in east Kuds, calling upon the Jordanian government to take positive steps to cope with this.

articles.title: MINREX aborda el tema de descubrimiento de restos mortales
articles.content:
MINREX aborda el tema de descubrimiento de restos mortales

					Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con respecto al reinicio de descubrimiento de restos mortales de uniformados estadounidenses entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio este viernes la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					
					Recientemente, la parte estadounidense nos envio por via correspondiente una carta oficial proponiendo las conversaciones sobre el descubrimiento de restos mortales de uniformados norteamericanos. 
					
					Aceptamos positivamente tal iniciativa desde el punto de vista humanitario. 
					
					Se realizan ahora las labores relacionadas con las conversaciones entre los circulos militares de ambas partes.

articles.title: EE.UU. decide ofrecer ayuda urgente a la RPDC
articles.content:
EE.UU. decide ofrecer ayuda urgente a la RPDC

					Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- El gobierno de Estados Unidos de America tomo la decision de ofrecer a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los suministros de ayuda emergente por las perdidas en las recientes inundaciones.

articles.title: "Ulji Freedom Guardian" es desafio a la paz, denuncia Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"Ulji Freedom Guardian" es desafio a la paz, denuncia Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- En desafio frontal a la paz, las autoridades surcoreanas iniciaron los provocativos ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" para amenazar y agredir a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					En un comentario individual divulgado este viernes, el diario Rodong Sinmun reitera que los ejercicios de guerra Sur de Corea-EE.UU. de diferentes tipos constituyen acto criminal que viola la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, y continua: 
					
					Los ejercicios de guerra resultan el factor principal de la agravacion de la tension. 
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas desean de veras el dialogo y la paz, no tendrian ningun motivo de desarrollar junto con las fuerzas extranjeras los ejercicios belicos contra la RPDC 
					
					Sin eliminar la confrontacion militar, no se puede esperar la mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas ni la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La realidad demuestra que el dialogo y la paz, de que hablan EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas, son palabras vacias para enganar y burlarse de la opinion publica y no pasan de ser una artimana barata para realizar su ambicion de agredir a la RPDC. 
					
					Si EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas estan interesados realmente en el dialogo y la paz, deben parar ahora mismo sus maniobras de guerra anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica a Japon por su ambicion de usurpar islote Tok
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica a Japon por su ambicion de usurpar islote Tok

					Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- El gobierno japones expuso en la "carta blanca de defensa para 2011" que "se queda en suspenso el problema del territorio de Takeshima, territorio propio de Japon". 
					
					Esta carta blanca se ha publicado por segunda vez en el mandato del poder del Partido Democratico. 
					
					El hecho prueba que la intencion de Japon de "tomar la posesion del islote Tok" es invariable tanto en el poder del Partido Democratico Liberal como en el del Partido Democratico. 
					
					Senala asi el rotativo Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este viernes y prosigue: 
					
					Los militaristas japoneses actuan con imprudencia persistiendo en la "posesion del islote Tok", parte del propio territorio coreano. 
					
					Tal insistencia de los reaccionarios japoneses, colmados de la ambicion de nueva agresion, parte del objetivo de provocar un conflicto en ese islote mediante la creacion de la opinion publica e internacionalizacion y preparar las condiciones y el pretexto favorables a la nueva agresion a Corea. 
					
					He aqui el caracter agresivo y peligroso de las maniobras de Japon tendentes a usurpar el islote Tok. 
					
					Pero, esto es una ilusion vana nunca realizable.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses no deben atreverse a tener ambicion de usurpar el islote Tok.
